intro: Calappa australis, commonly known as the Australian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Calappa australis has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the spring and summer months. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is relatively low maintenance.
